column5: Well, after a long lay-off, and a finally replaced rod, I got out for some steelhead this morning.  After checking a few tribs and finding only 2-4 inches of visibility, we finally settled on a trib and started drifting.  I went 1 for 2 landing a nice chromer, maybe 4 pounds or so.  My buddy James went 1 for 4 with another nice steelie.  I got mine on brown roe in a chartreuse bag, he got his on a little berkley power worm.  Packed it up at around noon and headed home.  Pics are now on here

Way to go Steve!  The conditions didn't sound optimal at all, but you still managed to catch some.  I'll be trying my luck at some night time steelies on the tribs maybe tomorrow night...after they clear up a bit more.  Awaiting your pics....
nice job bro!!! were we on the same trib??? seen so many people im not sure if i reconize ya!!! just yes or no dont name the creek  LOL!!! long drive from barrie if it was yes  lol

i go to school in lindsay, so it wasnt too long of a drive .... we'll say it was an "eastern" trib.  Could have seen you, we checked many tribs before settling at this one, and we only saw a couple people all morning.

awesome pics man! great catch  i have a quick question... i just started fishing for salmon a few years ago, on/off..  and i've never gone around this time of year, my question is if we're able to keep them? i have no problem either way, just curious. thanks!
i think you should read the regs
Looks like yer buddy there popped out of a bottle of champian.LOL  Nice bow.  Yep the regs,they sure help a fella stay out of trouble.
And why should I be reading the regs ?
I believe it was stated to kmb. I maybe wrong.  You can though check your pm,s.LOL
nice silver bullet steve.....well done    cheers
just did... thanks! i think i'm going to give it a shot next week for the first time! can't wait!
Nice trout, congrats on the 1st for 2007...  Mike
nice steelies boys,   i will be heading out with ya lots as soon as i can walk around a lil more...lol,   i walked out on B-ville pier today for a few casts
derek, tomorrow mornin fella if you're leg can handle it
